Author: 0x03#8822
Content:
right now the majority of 'low budget webradios' is forced to trust one of these
1) 15 year old software that best runs on 32bit, but then reliably and is so well documented you can just patch the binary with vi and all will be well v1.9.8 of shoutcast
2) more recent shoutcast 2.0 which is not so very developed at all. and if there is some activity, it's very strange decisions at times

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: so this will possibly be a  huge hit amongst the few 'independent' webradios in europe that are left, and probably also in other places

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: there are other solutions for web audio streaming obviously, but a lot of them are mildly to absolutely fucking expensive

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: you can also go for icecast but then again not a lot of the 'directories' listing streams will support it

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: and icecast isn't the very best thing if you're streaming mp3 either, although you can use it for that
